posts.post_content:
Looking to purchase T204  Ramly catchers. Prefer VG-EX condition.

Already have: Cliff Blankenship, Bill Carrigan, Lou Criger, Patrick Donahue, Red Kleinow, George Schlei, and Gabby Street.

Can purchase outright or I have plenty of trade items.

Thanks,

Patrick

It's been a very slow start to the year for me.

Hoping to add a few T204 catchers this year.

Looking for clean fronts. OK with back damage.

List of current T204s on previous post.

Thanks.

Patrick

No longer available
; sold at the show this weekend; 03/12/22.
Dean's Dugout Show, Naperville, IL.

I know that it is not in the "VG-Ex" category but I asked my son to send me pics of his Archer that I added to his collection many years ago. (A Dad taking care of his little kid)
Every good post needs pics! (lol)
One of the many things I love about this group; we can share our passion for our hobby; coming at it from all directions, all perspectives. I tend to drift towards battery mates; Ol' Jimmy Archer was three Finger Brown's mate, at one time.

Always looking to travel back to my days as a kid; trades are cool.
I am into, right now (looking for):
E91A; J. Collins, Bresnahan, Tinker, Evers, Brown.
E98: Meyers (Orange), Vaughn (Orange, Red),
Any Brownie; I am a member of "The St. Louis Brown's Historical Society" group on Facebook; love to impress the group, lol.
Being a Cubbie fan from way back; battery mates of Chicago Nationals.
Anything, Hank Aaron; my Dad was a Braves fan; when they won the '57 WS, era.
Too much more to list; just my current hunts.


[IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/picture.php?albumid=1393&pictureid=32791[/IMG]

[IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/picture.php?albumid=1393&pictureid=32792[/IMG]

Ben

"I love baseball history backstory; especially when it involves cards."

Successful transactions with: Casey2296, Jacklitsch, wolf441, shepbuckman, seablaster, Bridwell. brianp-beme, hatchetman325, quinnsryche, joejo20, Brian Van Horn, Thromdog, Webster, shammus.
